title: José Carlos Chaves
text:
José Carlos Chaves Innecken (born 3 September 1958 in <a href="Atenas">Atenas</a>) is a retired <a href="Costa%20Rica">Costa Rica</a>n <a href="association%20football">football</a> player who played for <a href="L.D.%20Alajuelense">Alajuelense</a>.
Club career.
After spending a year at a high school in <a href="Ohio">Ohio</a> and some time in the youth teams of <a href="Deportivo%20Saprissa">Saprissa</a>, Chaves joined <a href="L.D.%20Alajuelense">Alajuelense</a> in 1980 and moved abroad to play for <a href="Inter%20Bratislava">Inter Bratislava</a> in the <a href="Czechoslovak%20First%20League">Czechoslovak First League</a> during the 1990-91 and 1991-92 seasons. He returned to Costa Rica to win the 1992-93 league title with <a href="C.S.%20Herediano">Herediano</a>.
International career.
He was one of the eldest members of the <a href="Costa%20Rica%20national%20football%20team">national team</a> squad, that played in the <a href="1990%20FIFA%20World%20Cup">1990 FIFA World Cup</a> held in <a href="Italy">Italy</a>. Before the tournament, Chaves quit the national team since he was unhappy with coach Marvin Rodríguez, prompting de FA to replace Rodríguez by <a href="Bora%20Milutinovic">Bora Milutinovic</a> who immediately recalled Chaves.
The left-sided <a href="defender%20%28football%29">defender</a> or defensive midfielder played his final international game on 27 March 1994 against <a href="Norway%20national%20football%20team">Norway</a>.
Managerial career.
After retiring as a player, Chaves became assistant coach at Alajuelense and then sporting director at Herediano. In 2012, he became a director at Alajuelense junior league team.
Personal life.
Chaves is married to Lourdes González Rojas and they have three children.
